TopicTitle: Build a large base in Silisko's crater

Articles.Content:
In honor of our new team member, the Kerbals have set up a contest, to see which company can build the best base. You get points for how realistic it looks. The base must come with 5 modules:

1. Habitation module

2. Power module

3. greenhouse module

4. recreation module

5. storage module

6. you get more points with more modules too

It MUST be in Silisko\'s crater as well.

Post pictures and videos, or it never happened.
Bonus points for having an escape craft?

Bonus points for having an escape craft?

Yes, bonus points for ANYthing associated with the base. Com center, Com satellite, space station above for docking (Must have picture docked with landing legs), ETC.
Can we have the coordinates for the crater?
Silisko\'s is the biggest crater on the light side of the Mun. Easily seen from space.

It may be more that no-one has any idea about the modules you mention. They\'re not part of 0.15.2. At least I\'ve never seen them in the list of parts.

Have a good one,

Freddy
Well. it\'s something called mods, and creativity.

the light side of the Mun

There is no 'light side' of the Mun. From Kerbin, there\'s a near side and a far side. Same goes for Earth and Moon.
deff gonna try for this... i got my first research satellite orbiting kerbin. really nice view from there
What kind of structures could you put on a greenhouse? Just a bunch of modules together and imagine?

For a greenhouse, I\'d use large but not high station modules (maybe use radial attachment), since you need a lot of space to plant on but you probably don\'t want to grow mega-high trees ;P

Bonus points from my side for the power module that holds the most energy and the supply module that holds the most ZO2 ;D

Lol, no, Im not putting my base in Silisko crater. Mine is in what I\'m deeming the Apollo crater, as you are always seeing Kerbinrise. Its coordinates are 0, -53 roughly. Im just using this for ideas
heres i moon base i made for a different challenge but it will suffice, btw is this silisko crater?
